text: The 1982 California Golden Bears football team represented the University of California, Berkeley during the 1982 NCAA Division I-A football season. For the Golden Bears this season is historically known for its last game – the 85th Big Game against Stanford on November 20, 1982. Specifically – The Play. A last-second kickoff return on which Cal was able to score a touchdown to win the game. Because of the context of the rivalry, the timing of the play and the unusual multi-lateral way that it occurred, it is recognized as one of the most memorable plays in college football history and among the most memorable in American sports. ==Schedule== ==Roster== Not listed: Mariet Ford, Richard Rodgers ==Game summaries== ===Stanford=== {| class="wikitable" |- align="center" |- align="center" | 34–40–10 | 1981 | L, 21–42 |} ==1983 NFL Draft== {|class="wikitable" width="80%" |- align="center" style="" | Player || Position || Round || Pick || NFL Club |- align="center" bgcolor="" | Harvey Salem|| Tackle || 2 || 30 || Houston Oilers) |- align="center" bgcolor="" | Reggie Camp|| Defensive End || 3 || 68 || Cleveland Browns |- align="center" bgcolor="" | Wes Howell || Tight End || 4 || 105 || New York Jets |- align="center" bgcolor="" | Tim Lucas || Linebacker || 10 || 269 || St. Louis Cardinals |- align="center" bgcolor="" | John Tuggle || Running Back || 12 || 335 || New York Giants |- align="center" bgcolor="" |}https://www.pro- football-reference.com/draft/1983.htm ==References== California Category:California Golden Bears football seasons California Football
